body_html: IIRC the problem is that the Call objects in the servers have non-owned pointers to the service, both directly and through the responder_ object. A clean shutdown would need some way to wait until all of the pending calls had completed or been cancelled. At the time I implemented this, it didn't seem worth the additional bookkeeping to support this feature (and nobody had explicitly requested it). It would be great if you could come up with a simple solution here!

body: IIRC the problem is that the `Call` objects in the servers have non-owned pointers to the service, both directly and through the `responder_` object. A clean shutdown would need some way to wait until all of the pending calls had completed or been cancelled. At the time I implemented this, it didn't seem worth the additional bookkeeping to support this feature (and nobody had explicitly requested it). It would be great if you could come up with a simple solution here!
